text: The 1938 Washington State Cougars football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1938 college football season. Head coach Babe Hollingbery led the team to a 1–7 mark in the PCC and 2–8 overall. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | September 24 | Oregon | Home | 2-10 L | 6,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 1 | California | Home | 3-27 L | 10,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 8 | Stanford | Away | 0-8 L | 12,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 15 | USC | Away | 6-19 L | 35,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 22 | Oregon State | P | 6-7 L | 10,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 29 | Gonzaga | Away | 15-13 W | 9,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 5 | UCLA | Home | 0-21 L | 8,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 12 | Idaho | Away | 12-0 W | 7,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 26 | Washington | Away | 0-26 L | 20,000 |- ! scope="row" | December 3 | Oklahoma (5) | Away | 0-28 L | 15,000 |} ==References== Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1938 in Washington (state)
